feed.title: Coder Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Coder: v2.14.1
entry.content:
Changelog

Bug fixes

  • Add template editor to /templates/:templateName route group (#14206, d0feb70) (@aslilac)

    Resolves an issue preventing administrators from editing templates in the UI.

  • Revert status code change for delete users endpoint (#14168, b80d995) (@Emyrk)

    Resolves a breaking issue causing /users DELETE to return a 204 on success.

  • Delete user codersdk to support status code regression (#14173, b55a7a8) (@Emyrk)

Compare: v2.14.0...v2.14.1

Container image

  • docker pull ghcr.io/coder/coder:v2.14.1

Install/upgrade

Refer to our docs to install or upgrade Coder, or use a release asset below.

entry.title: New release for Coder: v2.14.2
entry.content:
Stable (since September 3, 2024)

Changelog

Changes

  • Sign the windows installer (#14353, 6f9b3c159) (@kylecarbs)
  • Re-add original create template context menu (#14326, bec6a26d0) (@jaaydenh)

    Fixes an issue which disabled the template create menu.

Compare: v2.14.1...v2.14.2

Container image

  • docker pull ghcr.io/coder/coder:v2.14.2

Install/upgrade

Refer to our docs to install or upgrade Coder, or use a release asset below.

entry.title: New release for Coder: v2.15.0
entry.content:
Changelog

[!NOTE] This is a mainline Coder release. We advise enterprise customers without a staging environment to install our latest stable release while we refine this version. Learn more about our Release Schedule.

Features

  • Add notification preferences database & audit support (#14100, e164b1e71) (@dannykopping)

    Notifications are now available via Webhook and SMTP behind the notifications experiment. Read our guide on setting up notifications to get started.

  • Add template delete notification (#14250, 6f1951e1c) (@BrunoQuaresma)
  • Add resume support to coordinator connections (#14234, cf8be4eac) (@deansheather)
  • Enable setting max port share level during template creation (#14366, cca451942) (@ethanndickson)
  • Add notification deduplication trigger (#14172, 9c8c6a952) (@dannykopping)
  • Add provisioning timings to understand slow build times (#14274, 6960d194a) (@dannykopping)
  • Add notification for suspended/activated account (#14367, c818b4ddd) (@mtojek)
  • Notify about manual failed builds (#14419, 47f2c7d68) (@mtojek)
  • CLI: Add shell completions (#14341, 0b2ba9606) (@ethanndickson)
  • CLI: Add p2p diagnostics to ping (#14426, 8c1519243) (@ethanndickson)
  • CLI: Add aws check to ping p2p diagnostics (#14450, 4b5c45d6d) (@ethanndickson)
  • Server: Allow mutating deployment values (#14414, 99e103e79) (@johnstcn)
  • Database: Retain most recent agent build logs (#14460, 0f8251be4) (@johnstcn)
  • Examples: Add envbuilder provider (#14405, 53e574663) (@johnstcn)
  • Dashboard: Implement notification UI (#14175, 21942afef) (@BrunoQuaresma)

    A UI for users to control their notification preferences. Requires the notifications experiment to be enabled, and notification delivery to be configured.

Bug fixes

  • Fix TestTailnet/Connect to wait for listener before dialing (#14148, dda9c5609) (@spikecurtis)
  • Ignore coderd log errors (#14166, f9b660e57) (@sreya)
  • Ignore errors on provided logger (#14169, 4e0cb60ee) (@sreya)
  • Extend locking in wsproxy to avoid race (and fix flake) (#14167, 203f48af5) (@sreya)
  • Document files API needs ustar format (#14152, 70a694ed4) (@spikecurtis)
  • Allow all users to read system notification templates (#14181, 58428aafc) (@dannykopping)
  • Allow tag removal in provisioner upsert (#14187, fab196043) (@f0ssel)
  • Lock adding to tailnet waitgroup to avoid race (and fix flake) (#14195, e09ad1ddc) (@ethanndickson)
  • Add template editor to /templates/:templateName route group (#14206, d0feb7081) (@aslilac)
  • Add version information to default docs links (#14205, d6c4d4722) (@bcpeinhardt)
  • Fix flaking Test_sshConfigExecEscape (#14233, 73402fc2f) (@ethanndickson)
  • Make default support links respect --docs-url (#14176, 76722a7db) (@bcpeinhardt)
  • Allow group members to read group information (#14200, 6f9b1a39f) (@hugodutka)
  • Avoid deleting peers on graceful close (#14165, 4fc047954) (@sreya)
  • Move to dogfood before terraform applying (363a01628) (@ethanndickson)
  • Use dogfood contents as template dir (#14332, 061379793) (@ethanndickson)
  • Show org summary page if not entitled (#14336, 4446d61fc) (@code-asher)
  • Label premium features in middleware error (#14360, f8f3d8967) (@code-asher)
  • Include provisioner timing action in hash func (#14388, cc944209a) (@dannykopping)
  • Set network telemetry client version on server (#14376, 4cc26be5e) (@ethanndickson)
  • Use authenticated urls for pubsub (#14261, ded612d3e) (@f0ssel)
  • Increase group name limit to 36 from 32 (#14443, 499769187) (@code-asher)
  • Detect nested dotfiles scripts (#14455, 63fe2305f) (@ethanndickson)
  • Wait for provisioner daemon jobs to finish after sigterm (#14466, c597c9260) (@ethanndickson)
  • Support additional http headers on agent (#14464, e65eb0321) (@ethanndickson)
  • Include dormant users in template acl query (#14461, ef7fcf393) (@code-asher)
  • Make non-existent asset paths return a 404 (#14472, cd38e297b) (@code-asher)
  • Delete workspace agent stats after 180 days (#14489, 628750232) (@ethanndickson)
  • Serve test derp map locally (#14490, 851df9199) (@ethanndickson)
  • Correctly close SMTP message and await response (#14495, c90be9b0c) (@dannykopping)
  • Restore closing SMTP message on method exit (#14496, 0f414a00d) (@dannykopping)
  • Use negative deadline to ensure timeout in TestWebhook/timeout (#14498, 9596f236c) (@dannykopping)
  • stop reporting future licenses as errors (#14492, 4eac2ac) (@spikecurtis)
  • allow posting licenses that will be valid in future (#14491, 5bd5801) (@spikecurtis)

    Administrators may now load licenses ahead of their starting date. New licenses will be used automatically upon their activation time.

  • CLI: Ensure that the support bundle command does not panic on zero values (#14392, 82e6070c7) (@johnstcn)
  • CLI: Add check for DisableOwnerWorkspaceExec in scaletest (#14417, 691486290) (@johnstcn)
  • Server: Humanize duration on notifications (#14333, 10327fb3a) (@BrunoQuaresma)
  • Database: Include a technical summary row on over-pagination (#14415, d4adfa390) (@johnstcn)
  • Examples: Use more precise example kubernetes template labels (#14028, f50e1d5a9) (@geniass)
  • Examples: Fix location of env file (#14422, 4bd7fe850) (@johnstcn)
  • Dashboard: Correct user agent data on audit row (#14243, 712a1b50d) (@BrunoQuaresma)
  • Minor fixups, added troubleshooting to notification docs (#14519, 66c8060) (@dannykopping)

Experimental Updates

These changes surround multiple organizations, which will be made available in a future release. Learn more in the guide on multi-org functionality in our docs.

  • Breaking: allow CreateUser to accept multiple organizations (#14383, c8eacc6df) (@Emyrk)
  • Show a warning when an organization has no provisioners (#14136, dfeafa8f5) (@aslilac)
  • Add organization-scoped permission checks to deployment settings (#14063, 097f73949) (@code-asher)
  • Add custom roles (#14069, 2e0532911) (@jaaydenh)
  • Add delete custom role context menu button and modal (#14228, 0b9ed57c1) (@jaaydenh)
  • Show summary if unable to edit org (#14214, ba4186dac) (@code-asher)
  • Show organization information on templates page (#14224, 59a80d70d) (@aslilac)
  • Filter templates by organization (#14254, 8563b372e) (@aslilac)
  • Improve custom roles create/edit page (#14456, 15d74a11a) (@jaaydenh)
  • Show organization name for groups on user profile (#14448, 49afab12d) (@aslilac)
  • Re-add original create template context menu (#14326, bec6a26d0) (@jaaydenh)
  • Only show valid organizations in CreateTemplateForm (#14174, 3b53f5ab4) (@aslilac)
  • Only show editable orgs on deployment page (#14193, 6019d0ba9) (@code-asher)
  • Use multi-org settings layout even if not licensed (#14215, abbcffe18) (@code-asher)
  • Filter "add group member" by organization (#14404, 88d7181a4) (@code-asher)
  • Fix light mode styles for organization delete button (#14485, 6bc93520c) (@aslilac)

Documentation

  • Advise against shared CODER_CACHE_DIRECTORY dir usage in note (#14216, d79a7adf9) (@dannykopping)
  • Add vs code extensions documentation (#14119, 238e9956f) (@ericpaulsen)
  • Move API and CLI docs routes under reference/ (#14241, 48f29a199) (@matifali)
  • Clone git repositories (#14090, f1feb40e1) (@BrunoQuaresma)
  • Add guide on using multiple organizations (#14012, c3ef7dc33) (@bpmct)

    Describes usage of the upcoming support for multiple organizations.

  • Add documentation for coderd terraform provider (#14374, d7800a43e) (@ethanndickson)

    Allows administrators to declare Coder resources via Terraform. See the provider repository for more information.

  • Add documentation for notifications, an experimental feature (#14478, 043f4f532) (@dannykopping)

Compare: v2.14.2...v2.15.0

Container image

  • docker pull ghcr.io/coder/coder:v2.15.0

Install/upgrade

Refer to our docs to install or upgrade Coder, or use a release asset below.

entry.title: New release for Coder: v2.14.3
entry.content:
Stable (since September 05, 2024)

Changelog

Bug fixes

  • Increase group name limit to 36 from 32 (#14443, 499769187) (@code-asher)
  • stop reporting future licenses as errors (#14492, 4eac2ac) (@spikecurtis)
  • allow posting licenses that will be valid in future (#14491, 5bd5801) (@spikecurtis)

    Administrators may now load licenses ahead of their starting date. New licenses will be used automatically upon their activation time.

  • Do not log entire resources in provisionerd (#14538, 5366f25) (@johnstcn)
  • Dashboard: fix agent logs streaming for third party apps (#14541, 242b1ea4) (@BrunoQuaresma)

Compare: v2.14.2...v2.14.3

Container image

  • docker pull ghcr.io/coder/coder:v2.14.3

Install/upgrade

Refer to our docs to install or upgrade Coder, or use a release asset below.
